# ForceEffectBase

**Protocol**

The base protocol for the wrapping force effect structure containing common parameters for all force-effects.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol ForceEffectBase
```

## Overview

Don’t implement this protocol yourself. Create force effects by calling methods on [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ForceEffect].

## Associated Types

- **ForceEffectType**: A type that represents the kind of force effect.

## Instance Properties

- **effect**: Custom force effect parameters.
- **mask**: Controls which collision groups will be affected by this force effect.
- **orientation**: Rotation of the force effect relative to the effect’s transform component.
- **position**: Position of the force effect relative to the effect’s transform component.
- **spatialFalloff**: Optional strength falloff based on the spatial bounds of the effect.
- **strengthScale**: A multiplier that scales the strength of the effect.
- **timedFalloff**: Optional strength falloff based on the duration of the effect.

## Custom forces

- **ForceEffectProtocol**: A protocol that defines a custom force effect.
- **ForceMode**: The options that control how physics system applies the forces.
- **ForceEffectParameters**: The force effect input data to the effect’s update handler or closure.

## Conforming Types

- ForceEffect
